data.title: Regent's University
data.meta_description: Regent's University: Located on 70 acres in the center of Regents Park, a beautifully manicured park with ponds, gardens and birds in Central London
data.text:
Regent’s University, London, England

See more info/photos from our visit to Regent’s University on Facebook, click here.

• Located on 70 acres in the center of Regents Park, a beautifully manicured park with ponds, gardens and birds in Central London

• The surrounding area is high end with spectacular residences and not far from the famed Regents Street that has all the shopping brands you could want and more

• Shops, restaurants, London at your doorstep is minutes away

• Known as an international college from over 130 countries, 15% of the students from the US, 40% from elsewhere in the European Union, 15% from Britain and a broad base from the UAE

• Private University therefore not part of the U.K. Public university system

• So Private that I felt like I was trying to enter Fort Knox! I did get some nice shots though of the beautiful campus as best I could

• 2nd University in the UK to be granted the status of a private university

• 5,000 students, 3,400 undergraduate, across 7 schools

• Offering a British or American degree

• Business and Management, psychology, drama, film and media, arts and social sciences, fashion and design

• Separate campus for fashion and design school

• Offers Bachelors, masters and doctoral degrees
